snippet: Philippine and Chinese officials on Wednesday called for a diplomatic solution to a naval standoff, while insisting that they would defend their territorial claims over islands in the South China Sea.
abstract: Philippine and Chinese officials call for a diplomatic solution to a naval standoff in the South China Sea, while insisting that they would defend their territorial claims in the region; at the same time a Philippine frigate and two Chinese ships position themselves near disputed islands in the South China Sea;

byline.contributor: Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Philippine and Chinese officials on Wednesday called for a diplomatic solution to a naval standoff, while insisting that they would defend their territorial claims over islands in the South China Sea.

headline.seo: Diplomatic Resolution Sought in South China Sea Standoff
headline.main: Philippines and China in a Standoff at Sea
headline.print_headline: Philippines and China In a Standoff at Sea
